intro: Cnicus repandus, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually lobed and arranged alternately along the stem. Cnicus repandus thrives in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry habitats.
